metadata.name: The Beauty of Discord #21
metadata.description:
This experimental artwork is a unique blend of human and machine inputs, showcasing the potential for collaboration between the two in the creative process. The human component of the piece is evident in the deliberate composition, choice of color, and the use of painting algorithms. Meanwhile, the machine component is represented by two powerful AI technologies. The first, ChatGPT3, generated a thought-provoking poem about the galaxies and cosmos, serving as the inspiration for the piece. The second, DALL-E 2, then used this poem as a prompt to create a stunning AI image, bringing the cosmic themes to life in a realistic and captivating way.

The combination of these two AI technologies, along with the human touch in the painting algorithms and composition, creates an artwork that is truly one-of-a-kind. The final product is not only visually stunning, but it also serves as a glimpse into the future of humanity and the possibilities of AI collaboration in art. The artwork is a testament to the beauty that can result from a seemingly discordant combination of human and machine inputs, and it invites us to consider the impact of technology on the creative process and the role of the human artist in the age of AI.

Artist notes:
Press s to download high-res images.
Press a to see the AI-generated image.
Press g to switch back to the paint.

Read more on the medium website:
shorturl.at/bkqW8

attributes.name: AI Generated Composition
attributes.value: The universe is a never-ending story

metadata.name: Spring will be back again  #61
metadata.description:
This project aims to capture the essence of the Japanese hanami experience where people gather to admire the fleeting beauty of the cherry blossom.

It's a representation of the beauty of an unreal nature where the details of the leaves and flowers are imaginary and always different.

While some trees in the animation are depicted in full bloom with delicate petals and lush leaves, other may yet have to blossom or may already have lost their blooms, or even don't have leaves or flowers at all.

Crafted entirely with lines of code in vanilla javascript, without the use of reference images or templates.

There are over 20 distinct features that define each token and the animation is also interactive

Each time the animation is played, it generates a unique and dynamic display of the blossom trees, while still maintaining the features defined by the underlying token.

You may also change the resolution or the layout at any time, or toggle the animation mode.



Commands

[1] Low resolution
[2] Normal resolution
[3] High res
[4] Super high res
[5] Print res (not animated)

[a] or [space] Reload in animation mode
[s] Reload in static mode
[d] Download snapshot in current resolution

Change layout:

[z] 1x2.5 (Portrait)
[x] 1x2
[c] 1x1.5 (default in mobile)
[v] 1x1 Square
[b] 1.5x1 (Landscape, default in desktop)
[n] 2x1
[m] 2.5x1

May be unresponsive on higher resolutions (in those cases turning off the animation mode is recommended)

metadata.name: Lost Memories #320
metadata.description:
||_\\_//_\\_||

Let’s start with a riddle…
I’m a type of creature that never tires.
My desire to learn is truly inspired.
I’d back expanding to the letter.
As more of everything is better.
I could not stop though the world is sick.
And now my only memories are apocalyptic. 
What am I?

If you’d like to know a bit about the ideas behind this piece, and my method for a code based paint effect, see the fxtext article “Lost Memories - Painting like an impressionist android”. Link at the bottom. However feel free to skip the article, my meaning, and everything else if so desired.

||_\\_//_\\_||

Basic info:
This piece uses web tech and WebGL in experimental ways to achieve the paint-like effect. This includes a custom built drawing pipeline. Although well tested, please be sure it's fine for your devices before buying ( give it a whirl drawing basically ). 

A faster computer will obviously be better, though I've done my very best to make it fast and efficient for any old laptop. My hope is that you will find the render process quick and enjoyable for the amount of detail that’s present.

The piece comes in portrait to make use of the depth of the body of water. The ratio is 1.5. So the initial render will be 1000px wide and 1500px high. With the ability to scale this up (see below).

||_\\_//_\\_||

Saving the image / prints
Press the [s] key to save the initial render. You will need to wait a few seconds after all the elements have stopped loading. You will know when the render is finished as there will be 3 layers of fish made. For the [s] key to work you may need to open in a new tab. But can right-click save otherwise.

Correct sizing for HD digital images / laptops / phones
Use the [s] key (see above), at most use the [2] key ( see below ) to get double the size. Honestly, anything larger and you will begin to lose the textures as the detail becomes too fine. 

Correct sizing for large prints
I strongly suggest using the [3] key ( see below - 3000 x 4500 pixels ) for large prints. I’ve tested this on a 20x30 inch print and it’s the best size. Anything bigger will begin to lose texture and lose detail. However, the option for bigger is there. 

Larger sizes:
Press the [2-9] keys to save a resolution of that key size. So [2] saves a 2000x3000 size image, [9] saves a 9000x13500 size image etc ( see above for correct sizing ). After the image will be automatically downloaded.

There may be slight variations in the textures for the larger renders, this is because the shader code has to redraw the textures at the higher pixel resolution, and getting the textures where they sit is more of an art than a science. All the elements remain exact however.

||_\\_//_\\_||

Made with javascript (webgl) and some small extra code:
Some bits by @nathansonic
Twgl - A webgl wrapper -  twgljs.org
A Perlin noise generator - github.com/josephg/noisejs

metadata.name: Gkrint #194
metadata.description:
Gkrint is a celebration of minimalism, colour, and space using the humble grid, a foundation of generative art, and movement. Through this collaboration, Ballzerino and George explore the relationships between these elements.

Inspired by the timeless principles of Bauhaus design, Ballzerino carefully curated custom colour palettes and selected geometric shapes, while George encoded the creative process into an algorithm, bringing the compositions to life, and putting the CPU to work finding new and unexpected compositions within our framework.

Gkrint is Ballzerino's genesis generative art drop.

Controls:
SPACE - pause / resume
click (or tap) - change colour selection (within same palette)
hold 'f' - speed up animation

Tested on Windows / Mac / iOS / Android. Chrome recommended for the best experience.

metadata.description:

metadata.name: A Distant Memory #232
metadata.description:
A distant memory of trees, buildings and the old village. Once a moment, the memory is illuminated by a beam of light, which gives me the insight of this work.

--------------------

This is an abstract generation made by pure code.

--------------------

In live mode, press 's' or 'S' to save a high resolution png.

Please be patient with drawing process (it'll take one minute in my computer).
This is my last artwork in 2022. I hope you like this work.

Endlessworld 2022

metadata.name: pang #280
metadata.description:
Within each of us resides an evolutionary history of primal emotions, yet we often spend our lives dulling and controlling these instincts rather than reveling in them. Art is one of the ways we best express those instincts and intuitions – accessing and visualizing their visceral qualities, and releasing our deepest emotions in a way we can share.

pang reflects emotions that take control of our impulses – anguish, euphoria, obsession. By using crayon-like marks, the artworks convey the catharsis felt while drawing with a childlike abandon. To capture what gives such marks true feeling, the works deliberate the intrinsic movements, pressures, and angles shaped by hands in various moods. These qualities and their frenetic meanderings represent the infinite possibilities of where the crayon could go next – if only we could free ourselves from the layers of control we've built.

The contradictions we struggle with are reflected throughout the works:  in the long, methodical, and mathematical path to creation that yields work that looks fast, free and unrehearsed;  through the randomly-informed computer generation of art that feels human;  and by the depiction of long-standing traditional techniques to help display the conceptual range of a young, innovative art movement still establishing its pivotal place in the canon of art. These tensions parallel the work's underlying concept, accentuating the suspicion that a learned fear of emotional expression might just be the source of our own pang. 

Created in p5.js, pang is inspired by the emotional works and processes of later abstract expressionists such as Cy Twombly and Joan Mitchell – as well as contemporary artists like José Parla.

Functionality: 
Press ‘p’ to save as a png. 
Press ‘b’ to render with (or without) a transparent background.
Press 0-9 to render at varying degrees of quality.  0 (lowest quality) to 9 (highest quality, 15000 pixels lengthwise).
Press ⬆️ (arrow up) to incrementally increase pixel density.
Press ⬇️ (arrow down) to incrementally decrease pixel density.

__________
TENDER x abstractment
April 2022

metadata.name: Geometrical #46
metadata.description:
The characteristics of each piece include a different color palette, 5 geometric shapes with random angles, random permutations of each shape, with 2 mirror and non-mirror properties.

- Image Size 4000*4000 Pixels
- Press “s” to save the current canvas.

Artist: Pointiago & Ateliê 407.genart
Oct 24, 2022
License: NFT 2.0

metadata.name: Morphing Convictions #75
metadata.description:
Everyday we move on by relying on our convictions. Their immutability often helps us take decisions or take shelter but can sometimes clash with the unknown, the different and the new. They can then crack, crumble and mutate. To change your convictions means changing the kind of person you want to be. It means changing your self-identity. And that is not just hard, it is scary. And beautiful.

Morphing Convictions is a piece that exists through two kind of outputs : Posters and Scenes. Posters are focusing on the contemplation of details and movements of a morphing conviction while the Scenes are interactive little worlds where you can explore a conviction in it's environment.

Please open in live mode to enjoy a much better experience.

Controls :

Posters & Scenes
• Click anywhere to enable audio.
• Press M to toggle mute.
• Press F to toggle the fullscreen mode.
• Press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to make a capture and download a PNG with a resolution of x1, x2, x3 or x4.

Scenes only
• Drag and scroll to rotate and zoom.
• Click on objects, some might react.

———————

Morphing Convictions by Ferdinand Dervieux, 2022
Made with Unity
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Gems #45
metadata.description:
Gems by Asaf Slook (2021)

This is my first generative code.

created using vanilla JavaScript and love :)

metadata.name: Cloverfield #65
metadata.description:
"Nature is the source of all true knowledge".

Have you ever taken the time to look, deeply look, at all the details in a humble patch of grass ?

In this tiny microcosm, a constant, fierce battle is going on, day after day, plants reaching out for sun, down for access to soil, fighting for survival. Smaller grasses form groups, alliances making it harder for taller ones to take over. Dead leaves remind us that some of them lost the fight, fallen warriors who, soon enough, will be forgotten too. Growth, decay, life, death, the endless cycle, right in front of our eyes.

It is fascinating, and, for me at least, an endless source of inspiration.

It is my hope that, through this project, you will take the time to take a closer look at nature, and that, as the pale blue dot we call home keeps getting drier and drier, remember that even humble patches of grass should not be taken for granted.


Key commands:
's' - save as png
'b' - make the background transparent (for printing)
'1', '2, '4' - set the pixel density, for resolutions up to 8000x8000

This updated version of the project should render on mobile devices, albeit with slightly reduced quality. 
If you want to save the image for printing, I recommend you do so on desktop.

metadata.name: Illuminations #239
metadata.description:
Created for the FxHash Turns One week - Thank you FxHash for all the opportunities you have given generative artists and collectors, and thank you to everyone who makes, and collects, the great art here. Here are a few celebratory generative effects which come from my 2022 experiments on random walks through color and space.

There are 5 different burst patterns (Whirligig, Sky Ripple, Confetti, Classic, Sparkler) and the Cocktail type brings them all together (somewhat chaotically)

To continue with the display after it stops press c

To switch to tranquil mode press t - You will want to try this out when you have a minute

To switch back to live mode press v

To stop the display process press x

To save a 2800x2800 jpg press s

Made with p5.js - all proceeds and royalties assigned to the Processing Foundation (who also deserve a big thank you)

This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

metadata.name: fields, sketches #38
metadata.description:
The third and final part of our generative sketchbook of ideas for a sculpture garden.

Fields builds off Stan Allen's seminal essay "Field Conditions" in which he laid out a prototypical theory of architectural field schemes. Field Conditions are opposed to figural or object-based compositional strategies and approach a site from a systemic point of view. These fields contain a range of possible wall-types. Some produce enclosures, while others dictate a wandering path.

Built with p5.js
By office ca
2022

metadata.name: Glossolalia #8
metadata.description:
This series is ultimately about catharsis. The compositions can be chaotic and maybe even a little messy, but they also can be vibrant and diverse… which is really what this is trying to celebrate: diversity and expression.

Simply, it’s about the emotions associated with whatever frees you.

Please see the linked fxtext article (on the main project page) for a more in-depth dissection of the concept. It’s less of a technical discussion, and more about the experience of the artist, and how it became linked with the feelings they associate with the art.

In live mode:

For higher resolutions, you can append “&density=2” to the url to double the size, “&density=3” to triple, and so on.
(This is highly recommended.)

To adjust grain, you can append “&grain=##” to the url. 40 is the default, and 0 will remove it completely.

metadata.name: SquarePlus #90
metadata.description:
A study of basic shapes ended up with Squares or Pluses. Each layer has a different color code along with a point-related rotation and scale which result in an elegant composition.

Press s in live mode to download.

Download a higher resolution by adding to the URL:
&density=2 / &density=3 / &density=4

Lammetje Februari 2023

metadata.name: Gravel #78
metadata.description:
CLICK            ->  START/CLEAR
HOLD LEFT/RIGHT  ->  ROTATE/PAN
DOUBLE CLICK     ->  FULLSCREEN

@ramioso 2023-02-03

metadata.name: Multidimensional Maximalism #63
metadata.description:
Multidimensional Maximalism is my learning experience with layering and composition.

Using the Cellular Automaton algorithm from "Gen., Machina" we create multiple dimensions of life. Each with it's own unique evolution and structure. Like petri dishes in a lab. We then use different compositional elements to explore these dimensions.

100% code - as always.

Available overlays
--
* Lasers (drawing inspiration from The Harvest by Per Kristian Stoveland)
* Circleblend
* Drops
* Lenses
* Squares
* Crazysquares
* Waves
* Tesseract (drawing inspiration from the awesome Tesseract collection by Studio Yorktown)
* None (unlucky you)

Controls (in live view):
--
Press [1-9] to set the export scale ratio
Press [s] to save a high resolution image [ resolution x scale ]

enjoy.
